column4: hello 2 all, i need some help on routing all my outgoing traffic trough a proxy server
its because i want to download some xbox live region specific content
what's your network look like?
correction, maybe yeah...but you'll need a box to redirect that traffic
you could use an ssh tunnel and not have to worry about the protocol.
you know what tools i should install to setup my proxy server
do you know how to configure iptables so that i can proxy my traffic to the vpn?
yes...youll need to know the ports you're working with.
sudo iptables -t nat -A PREROUTING -p tcp --dport 3074 -j DNAT --to-destination localhost
i run that on my vps, right?
then do "ssh -L 3074:<xbox-server>:3074 <user>@<remote-host>"
this must be on your "firewall" between your xbox and the internet.
you'll need to figure that out unless your xbox can be setup to use a proxy.
but you can use iptables's LOG target to figure it out.
problem is, your XBox would have to know how to use a socks proxy.
the "*" won't work.
and you'll need to redirect the traffic to that ssh tunnel.
ssh -L <port>:65.59.234.161:<port> <user>@<US-remote-host>
both those need to be run on your linux-based firewall.
not the Us-based server.
iptables v1.3.6: Bad IP address `localhost'
then use "127.0.0.1" instead of localhost.
